div1.p: Fishbein requests photographs for an article on Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from Morris Fishbein to Laura Armistead Carter, February 18, 1926
div1.opener:
HYGEIA
A JOURNAL OF INDIVIDUAL AND COMMUNITY HEALTH
MANAGING EDITOR, MORRIS FISHBEIN, M.D.
BUSINESS MANAGER, WILL C. BRAUN
EDITORIAL ADVISORY BOARD
OLIN WEST, M.D., SECRETARY AND GENERAL MANAGER, A.M.A.
JOHN M. DOWSON, M.D., DIR., BUREAU OF HEALTH
AND PUBLIC INSTRUCTION
ARTHUR J. CRAMP, M.D., DIRECTOR, BUREAU OF
INVESTIGATION
Miscl
American Medical Association
535 North Dearborn Street
CHICAGO
February 18, 1926.
Hygeia.
Miss Laura Armstead Carter,
2121 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
We have been able to work up
in our own office a brief article on your dis-
tinguished father, and we are interested in
getting two or three photos on Ship Island to
accompany the article.

We should also like a picture
of yourself as collaborator in the preparation
of the book on “The History of Yellow Fever.”

Can you not furnish us with
these pictures? We should like to have them
within the next week if possible.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Morris Fishbein
Editor, HYGEIA TW
